poem:
**Spirals of Yesterday**

In the heart of Europe, shadows convene,
Wilders, Orbán, whispers swirl.
Freedom's tale, a fragile dream,
Dread tracked in graphs, a digital whirl.

Green tears fall, a pixel's lament,
Votes like ghosts from yesteryears.
We map the past, our future bent,
History's echo through the vale of fears.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Wilders and Orbán congratulate Austria’s far-right Freedom party on poll success – latest updates 11.00am BST German Green MEP Daniel Freund reacted to the Austrian election’s outcome with an emoji. 😢 pic.twitter.com/afDmLUUvuF— Daniel Freund (@daniel_freund) September 30, 2024 10.25am BST Here’s an interesting graph of where the far-right’s votes came from. Hier findet ihr die #Wählerstromanalyse zur #NRWahl24: https://t.co/ETBo37a15G pic.twitter.com/r6EtSU1L4r— DER STANDARD (@derStandardat) September 30, 2024 10.11am BST Here’s a map from ORF showing which". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
